description.narrative: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows: 1. Increased Access to Trade Finance Lines: The Facility will finance up to US$2 billion of energy imports to Cote d''Ivoire over two years by providing much needed reasonably priced trade lines for its cross border flows. It will support a fragile economy''s growth and generate financial savings for a strategic enterprise which could serve to retool and improve its productive and operational capacity. Improved supply of refined products would also have a positive impact on the country''s macroeconomic stability and GDP growth. 2. Support to SIR , and Downstream Operators: By providing adequate and much needed financing, the Facility will help the Company''s stabilization plan. As a result, many jobs will be preserved. In addition, it would benefit other agents who are on its supply chain, such as local private companies involved in transportation, distribution, and retail of refined oil products. This will support employment in these companies, an important factor given the high level of unemployment rate in the country. 3. Revenue to the Government: The Project will help the government of Cote d''Ivoire''s finances, especially through taxation and indirectly through reduction in production costs due to savings resulting from lower financial expenses. .

The proposed project consists of a US$300 million two year trade facility (Facility) to provide the necessary financing to Société Ivoirienne de Raffinage (SIR) - a refinery in Cote dIvoire- for its importation of crude oil. Cote dIvoire is an IDA country which is also conflict affected. The refined products are to serve the domestic market in Cote dIvoire and regional markets of Burkina Faso and Mali, and other international markets.
